description: Dive into "Discover Kitakyushu's Hidden Green Gems" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Discover Kitakyushu's Hidden Green Gems

places.generalDescription: Hinoyama Park is a public park situated on Mount Hinoyama, offering breathtaking views of the straits and the city below. Visitors can reach the park via an aerial cable car or by driving through the toll-free Hinoyama Parkway. Additionally, there is a walking trail for those who prefer to hike. The park features an observation deck, a tulip garden, and a small gift shop at the top.

sources.snippet: An even more spectacular view of the straits and the city below can be found from the peak of Hinoyama. A 10-minute walk north from Mimosusogawa Park up a small hill leads to the ropeway station in Hinoyama Park, where you can ride a cable car to the 268 m peak. The peak is also accessible by the toll-free Hinoyama Parkway (a 10-minute drive) and a walking trail (60-minute walk).
sources.shortName: Events, experiences and nature in Kitakyushu and Shimonoseki

places.name: Hinoyama Park

reviews.text:
Visited 29 Mar 2024
Unfortunately the cherry blossoms were late this year, but the view was still nice and the old ropeway was a fun experience.

Took a morning hike up to the top. Beautiful view! I took the main road as far as I was allowed to walk and then took the trail. It's less than a km to meet the cable car landing, and the path is easy to follow.

A nice little park atop Hinoyama.  There is a small gift shop, viewing platform and eating area at the top also.  There is a cable car line up to the top, but in all my visits I never used it.  The parking is free and offers lots of spots.

The view from the top of the mountain is pretty spectacular.  You can take in the whole of the Kanmon strait, looking across to Kyushu.  You also get great views towards Shimonoseki city and Korea (though obviously Korea isn't visible).

There is also what I assume to be an old artillery fort with old bunkers and gun emplacements that you can explore.  Quite creepy at night.

places.generalDescription: Hibikinada Ryokuchi, also known as Green Park, is the largest park in Kitakyushu City and offers a variety of attractions for visitors. The 4-hectare Large Lawn Open Space at the center of the park provides a relaxing area for families to enjoy. Visitors can explore elaborate flower gardens, observe flora and fauna including Japan's largest butterflies, and experience interactions with ponies, goats, kangaroos, and other small animals.

sources.snippet: In 1991, the City of Kitakyushu hosted an urban greenery expo called Green Renaissance to showcase its transition towards a more sustainable and eco-friendly model. A massive venue was built for this event next to the Tonda Reservoir, and this is what is now Green Park—by far the city’s largest park. Green Park offers a wide array of activities that are fun for the whole family.
sources.shortName: Events, experiences and nature in Kitakyushu and Shimonoseki

places.name: Hibikinada Ryokuchi (Green Park)

reviews.text: I hadn't been to "Green Park" for more than 25 years until recently, but it's still a wonderful place to enjoy the greenery, breathe and relax from the daily hustle and bustle.
The place is so lovely, I just want to spend all day long here.

places.address: 1006 Takenami, Wakamatsu Ward, Kitakyushu, Fukuoka 808-0121, Japan

places.generalDescription: Adachi Park is a picturesque forest park located at the base of Mt. Adachi, offering stunning views of Kokura town and Kitakyushu city from its 597.8m altitude. The well-maintained park features clean roads, beautiful trees, and ample car parking. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks, runs, or picnics while breathing in the fresh air and taking in the breathtaking vistas.

sources.snippet: The most popular spot is Mount Sarakura, and there are also famous night-view locations scattered throughout the city, such as the Takatoyama Park and the Adachi Park. Additionally, tourist destinations like the Mojiko Retro Area, the Wakato Bridge, and the Kokura Castle are illuminated all the time, offering different atmospheres during the day and night. Moreover, Kitakyushu City has its unique charm with “industrial nightscapes,” showcasing the historical development of the city as an industrial hub.
sources.shortName: Guide for Enjoying Night Views in Kitakyushu City! Enjoying Japan's Finest Night Views and Savoring Local Cuisine | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Adachi Park

reviews.text: It was so beautiful. It is very well maintained as you can see clean roads and beautiful trees. There is place for car parking as well. You don't have to worry about thirst because vending machine is there also. The view of the kitakyushu city from the above is breathtaking. You can go there for a walk or running or have a picnic...
Very well maintained park. Good place for a couple hours of walking

This is a hauntingly beautiful park. A haven for nature-lovers. I went here to take a nice stroll and re-energize myself.
I hope the authorities preserve the relatively untouched state of this forested park.
For me, one of the nicest nature parks in Kyushu, Japan.

sources.snippet: The view from the mountain has been chosen as one of the three "new great night views of Japan," and the "100 best night views of Japan." The mountain can be hiked on foot, and there is also a slope car and cable car available from Hobashira Park. The mountain offers views over Kitakyushu and towards Japan's main island of Honshu.
sources.shortName: Kitakyushu | Fukuoka | Kyushu | Destinations | Travel Japan

places.name: Hobashira park Sarakuradaira square.

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) I often climb Mt. Sarakura, but this year I went to see the sunrise for the first time.

(Original)
普段からよく登る皿倉山ですが、今年は初めて初日の出を見に行ってきました。

(Translated by Google) It is located halfway between the summit of Mt. Sarakura and Mt. Gongen, and there are restrooms and vending machines.
Parking is prohibited and there was some construction going on when I went there recently. (The photo is from before)

(Original)
皿倉山山頂と権現山山頂の中間ほどにありトイレや自販機がある。
駐車は禁止となっていて直近行った時は何やら工事中でした。(写真はそれ以前のもの)

(Translated by Google) It's been more than 20 years since I rode a trail vehicle (off-road bike), and it's been even longer since I rode on a forest road.
So, I came here in search of a forest road that was much less crowded than it was back then.
Of course, be careful not to get in the way of climbers.
Fortunately, the route up to this point seems to be mostly done by car.
It's my first time and it's a weekday, so I'm not sure. There are other promenades nearby.
It's nice to have a restroom and a small parking lot.
There was a route to Mt. Gongen from here, but it looked like a sidewalk, so I didn't go there.
Is there a campsite nearby?
I wanted to make sure. There was rain in the forecast, so maybe next time (lol)

(Original)
トレール車(オフロードバイク)に、20年以上ぶり、林道を走るのはそれ以上ぶり。
なので、当時よりもかなり減った林道を求めてここへ。
もちろん、登山者さんの邪魔にならない様に気をつけて。
幸い、ここまでのルートは、車利用が主みたいな気がします。
初めてだし、平日なので、確信まではありませんけど。周りに別の遊歩道もあるので。
トイレもあり、ちょっとした駐車場もあるのも良いですね♪
ここから、権現山に行くルートがありましたが、そこは歩道な感じに見えたので、行ってません。
キャンプ場も近いのかな？
確かめたかったのですが。雨予報もありましたから、また次回にでも(笑)

places.address: Okura, Yahatahigashi Ward, Kitakyushu, Fukuoka 805-0048, Japan

sources.snippet: Mt. Komonji is a 366-meter-high mountain, similar in height to Mt. Adachi in Kitakyushu. The night view from here is actually incredibly beautiful, and is on a par with the famous view from Mt. Sarakura. There is, of course, also an expansive view that covers Kokura City and Mojiko.
sources.shortName: 12 Must-See Enchanting Nightscapes in Kitakyushu and Fukuoka

places.name: Mt. Komonji

reviews.text:
Hiking Mt. Komonji (小文字山) – A Rewarding Urban Escape in Kitakyushu

Last week, I hiked Mt. Komonji (小文字山) in Kitakyushu, and it was an invigorating experience! Though the trail is short, it presents a steep climb that challenges even seasoned hikers. The effort is well worth it, as the summit offers breathtaking panoramic views of Kitakyushu city, especially enchanting during twilight. ￼

Trail Insights:
•	The ascent is steep and can be slippery in parts; sturdy hiking shoes are recommended.
•	Safety ropes and chains are available on the trail to assist with the climb.
•	The hike typically takes about an hour to reach the summit.

Tips:
•	Bring sufficient water and perhaps a light snack to enjoy at the top.
•	If you plan to descend after sunset, carry a flashlight or headlamp, as the trail can be quite dark. ￼

By Car:
Many visitors choose to drive to the trailhead. There is a parking area available near the starting point of the hike, providing a convenient option for those traveling by private vehicle.

On Foot:
For those preferring to walk, the trailhead is within walking distance from JR Kokura Station. The hike from the station to the base of Mt. Komonji offers a pleasant stroll through the city, allowing hikers to experience the local atmosphere before beginning the ascent.

Mt. Komonji may not be as renowned as nearby Mt. Sarakura, but it offers a serene and less crowded alternative with equally stunning views. It's a perfect spot for those seeking a quick yet fulfilling hike within the city.
A few wooden benches and tables with lovely views over the city. The walk up, although short, is steep with many steps.

if you're planning to hike Mt. Komonji move forward to Mt. Adachi and Takakura Yama it is all connected. You just need to bring lots if WATER also prep meals in case you are hungry. There is a connection within the area, you may use GPS. Have fun!

places.address: Tomino, Kokurakita Ward, Kitakyushu, Fukuoka 802-0036, Japan
